Magnitude of costs associated with extreme-event changes are likely to be large. Indirect costs are a significant portion of total costs and therefore need to be included in cost estimates. No specific value provided, so 0 is given.

To avoid extensive retrofitting in the next decades, all infrastructures must be designed much more resilient than it was the case in absence of climate change; hence, the high adaptation costs for infrastructure. No specific value provided, so 0 is given.

Many strategies to limit hurricane damages are obviously ‘‘no-regret’’ strategies, meaning that they would yield significant benefit even if hurricane frequency and intensity remain unchanged. No specific value provided, so 0 is given.
